reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in June. Frau Steiner warmly greeted us and showed us to our room upon arrival. The room was lovely with a fantasic view across farm fields to the nearby mountains. Everything was clean and although the bathroom was small, the room was larger than most we've stayed in. There is a computer with internet access in one of the common rooms for use by the guests.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in Salzburg!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good with a variety of choices, including meats, cheese, eggs, cereals and bread along with juices and coffee.
reviews.title: Two 78-year-old travelers stayed a month.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house is located in a quiet area not far from the center of Salzburg. A bus stop is only a few minutes walk from the house and there are several place nearby to eat dinner.
reviews.title: We loved the peace and tranquility.

reviews.text: Frau Steiner was the best hostess a traveller could have. She speaks English very well and can help you with any question you might have about Salzburg and the surrounding area. She will book side tours for you and she also has the Salzurger card, which gives you access to the bus system and free admission to most attractions in the city. We would highly recommend Haus Steiner to anyone wishing to visit Salzburg.
reviews.title: It felt like we were staying with friends!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed staying at Haus Steiner in 2005 and decided this year we wanted to stay a month to enjoy again the tranquil setting. We had a car and took one-day trips suggested by Frau Steiner and Frommer's Austria's Best-Loved Driving Tours. We agree with the other recommendations and liked our stay for many reasons. To start with, Haus Steiner was pleasant, comfortable, interesting, and convenient. The pleasant atmosphere began each morning with Frau Steiner greeting us at morning coffee and breakfast. We talked about what we did the day before and what we planned to do the coming day. She added information about the area and provided ideas of what to see and how to see it. We will likely stay at Haus Steiner again.
reviews.title: A beautiful stay

reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Haus Steiner. The area, which is about 15-20 minutes from downtown Salzburg, is peaceful and beautiful. The bus, which comes by several times an hour,stops just a few minutes from the B&B, which makes it very convenient to get to and from downtown. There are several restaurants within walking distance as well. The best part of staying here is the wonderful proprieter, Rosemarie, who is very accomodating and helpful. We are looking forward to our next visit. Many thanks.
reviews.title: A wonderful host, beautiful scenery and a great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed a fantastic visit in Salzburg staying at Haus Steiner. It was perfect for what we needed. A cozy, friendly B&B with great value. Frau Steiner was a wonderful help when we had questions and was such a warm hostess. We easily caught the bus into downtown Salzburg. Actually, it was nice staying away from it all - it gave you a nice cultural taste of Austria. We were very warm and comfortable sleeping. Our breakfast was tasty and filling. The Sound of Music minivan picked us up right at the front doorstep. Everything about our stay was perfect. Now we are recommend that our friends stay at Haus Steiner, too.
reviews.title: Just what we were looking for

reviews.text: Haus Steiner is located outside of the city. Just a short bus ride to the location. Beautiful view of the alps, clean,affordable and great service. I would definitely come back again. Rosemarie is a great hostess !
reviews.title: Great View, affordable and warm and nice service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After our river cruise down the Danube, we spent 3 days in Salzburg which became the undisputed highlight of our trip. For anyone visiting Salzburg, Haus Steiner is without question the best we have encountered anywhere. This guest house is perfectly situated just outside the bustle of downtown with spectacular views of the mountains. Our room (it was actually a suite) had a balcony and large glass doors facing the Untersberg mountain! (For those who have seen The Sound of Music, this it the one in the movie). The beauty of the sunrise on the peaks was breathtaking. We were fortunate to hit clear weather, and from our bed the starlit & moonlit view of the mountain was so beautiful, our words will not do it justice.
reviews.title: Outstanding facilities & host

reviews.text: More importantly, Rosemarie Steiner made us feel like it was home. Her warm personality and in-depth knowledge of anything you wanted to do in Salzburg, was invaluable. She arranged tours, provided us with the "Salzburg Card" (enables you to take any bus and get into any of the major sites), and also advised us which tours were probably not worth it. Oh, my wife Katie is an absolute stickler for cleanliness. When she declared that Haus Steiner is so clean and neat you could eat off the floors, I knew we were in the right place. Breakfast was excellent, and the coffee to die for. Her English was also excellent and when my terrible German failed, she mercifully switched to English. Internet service was available, and the cable modem lighting fast.
reviews.title: The best of Salzburg!

reviews.text: If you want to find a very comfortable place with a friendly atmosphere for a good rest after a day full of bright emotions and Salzburg’s sightings, I would strongly recommend you to choose this pleasant house.
reviews.title: A home away from home!!!

reviews.text: For me it was not just a house rather it became a real home away from home for 5 splendid days in this September.
reviews.title: Charming, Charming, Charming

reviews.text: We stayed at Mrs. Steiner's B&B for 3 nights this May.
reviews.title: Stunning View and Value for Money

reviews.text: Haus Steiner is very conveniently located just about 15 minutes drive from the centre of Salsburg by car. Right outside the house it is well connected by Bus service (bus runs every 15 minutes) to Salsburg in case you do not have a car.
reviews.title: Super Value and Beautiful Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B feels like your own home. It is neat, clean and well maintained. The view from room numbers 3 & 4 are stunning. You see the lush green meadows with the Austrian Alps in the background.
reviews.title: Loved it!
Beautiful B&B - wonderful scenery - excellent price!
reviews.text: Mrs. Steiner is a wonderful host and would be happy to assist you in any tourist information that you might require for Salsburg and surrounding areas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at Haus Steiner and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Salsburg. Very good value for money with internet and breakfast.
reviews.title: Absolute Gem!
